analyzed: de dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½de la 'phags @324a *//
translated: These are called the seven factors of awakening.ğŸ”½â€œWhat are the four noble truths?

original: 'di lta ste /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la /

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par sems gnas pa /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par sems gnas pa /

original: de ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa zhes bya'o //

translated: This is called the signless gate of liberation.

analyzed: de la bsam gtan bzhi gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste / sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa / ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
translated: He accomplishes and abides in the first concentration, which possesses investigation and analysis, and is filled with joy and bliss born of seclusion.

original: bde ba lus kyis myong la /ğŸ”½'phags pa rnams kyis gang de la dran pa dang ldan pa /ğŸ”½bde ba dang ldan pa /

analyzed: bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bde ba'ang spangs te; snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'ang nub pas sdug bsngal yang ma yin /

analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin pa / btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa /

translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great immensity, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-discarded phenomena, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-apprehension.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams @330b cad stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams @330b cad stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: de la nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: â€œWhat is inner emptiness?

original: nang gi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nang gi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Inner phenomena are as follows:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid de /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid de /
translated: the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mig ni mig gis stong ngo //
analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mig ni mig gis stong ngo //
translated: The eyes are empty of the eyes, because they do not endure and they are not destroyed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the nature of those.

original: de bzhin du ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis stong ngo //
translated: In the same way, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are empty of mind because they do not endure eternally and they are not subject to destruction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is the nature of those.

original: de ni nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called â€œemptiness of internal phenomena.â€

original: de la phyi stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phyi stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: â€œWhat is the emptiness of external phenomena?â€

original: phyi'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyi'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: External phenomena are as follows:

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams te /

analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir gzugs rnams ni gzugs rnams kyis stong ngo //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and mental phenomena are empty of mental phenomena because they do not endure eternally and they are not subject to destruction.

analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams ni chos rnams kyis stong ngo //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /

original: de ni phyi stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni phyi stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of the external.

analyzed: de la phyi nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na / phyi dang nang gi chos rnams zhes @331a *//
translated: â€œWhat is the emptiness of the external and internal?â€

original: bya ba ni nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug ste /
translated: The internal and the external are the six sense sources of the internal and the six sense objects of the external.

analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir nang gi chos rnams ni nang gi chos rnams kyis stong ngo //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir phyi'i chos rnams kyang phyi'i chos rnams kyis stong ngo //
translated: The external phenomena are empty of the external phenomena because they do not endure and they do not disintegrate.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /

original: de ni phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //

original: de la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na /

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa'i stong pa nyid des kyang chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid stong ngo //

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /

original: de la chen po stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chen po stong pa nyid gang zhe na /

analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir shar phyogs ni shar phyogs kyis stong ngo //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams bzhi ste /

analyzed: phyogs de brgyad kyang de bzhin no //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: de ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //

analyzed: de la @331b don rnam pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na / don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba la / don dam pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œWhat is the emptiness of ultimate reality?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni mya ngan las 'das pas stong ngo //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /

original: de ni don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //

original: de la 'dus byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na /

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams te /
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams te /

analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams kyis stong ngo //

analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyis stong ngo //

analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni chos gang la skye ba med pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa ste /

analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas ni 'dus ma byas kyis stong ngo //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /

original: de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //

translated: â€œWhat is the emptiness of beyond extremes?

analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir chos gang la 'ong ba mi dmigs pa'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /

original: de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //

analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir gang la chos gang yang dor du med pa'o //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is its nature.

analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid gang zhe na / ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir 'dus byas sam /

analyzed: gzugs kyi @332b mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba / tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni myong ba /

original: de la chos thams cad stong pa nyid gang zhe na /

analyzed: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see that the eyes are either to be cultivated or not to be cultivated.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la brtson zhes bya ba'am /ğŸ”½mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la brtson zhes bya ba'am / mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see that the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are either to be cultivated or not to be cultivated.

original: de bzhin du gzugs rnams la brtson zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs rnams la brtson zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He does not see that sights are either to be cultivated or not to be cultivated.

original: mi brtsen  zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams la brtson zhes bya ba'am /ğŸ”½mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi brtsen  zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams la brtson zhes bya ba'am /ğŸ”½mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see that sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and thoughts are either to be cultivated or not to be cultivated.

original: de bzhin du mig gi khams la brtson zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi khams la brtson zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Similarly, it is said that one should strive for the eye constituent.
